links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: (2^(n+2)-n-3) '*' (2^(n+2)-n-3) where '*' denotes the convolution product.G.f.: 1/((1-2*x)*(1-x)^2)^2.Partial sums of A045889.a(n) = (n-3)*2^(n+4)+binomial(n+3,3)+4*(binomial(n+1,2)+4*n+12)     = 2^(n+4)*(n-3)+(n+7)*(n*(n+11)+42)/6.a(n) = binomial(n+3,3)*hypergeom([2,-n],[-n-3],2). - _Peter Luschny_, Sep 19 2014
mathematica: Table[Sum[ k Binomial[n + 5, k + 4], {k, 0, n+1}], {n, 0, 26}] (* _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jul 08 2009 *)Table[(16 (n-3) 2^n + (n + 7) (n^2 + 11 n + 42) / 6), {n, 0, 40}] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 20 2014 *)
author: _Wolfdieter Lang_
